dlgLine.text: Si vous nous rejoignez, vous écoutez Lane on the Fast Lane ici sur KHEK, qui entame son huitième jour de diffusion, vous apportant les dernières nouvelles et les sons les plus frais de ce qui pourrait être la fin du monde. Tout à l'heure, nous avons entendu Squirrel Jelly avec 'Someone Left the Light On' et avant cela, nous avons entendu le son de moi en train de manger une barre protéinée - mmm, miam.
<Baille>Maintenant, passons aux choses sérieuses. Je viens de recevoir un rapport sur le système d'urgence, et c'est très important. [Effet d'écho] Faites très attention à ceci...
C'est un bulletin de l'Agence fédérale de gestion des urgences, et vous me connaissez, je ne suis pas très sérieux, mais cela pourrait vous sauver la vie.
D'après ce... Euh, attendez, laissez-moi lire cette partie... "Les antibiotiques pris quotidiennement contrôleront l'infection, mais ne la guériront pas".

Les personnes infectées qui prennent des doses quotidiennes d'antibiotiques ne présenteront aucun symptôme ni aucune progression de la maladie". Donc, si vous m'écoutez et que vous savez comment vous procurer des antibiotiques, je vous conseille vivement d'en garder une réserve pour les cas d'urgence. Cela pourrait vous sauver la vie. Je le répète...

dlgAnsw.text: <Le DJ continue de répéter la même annonce.>

dlgLine.text: ...Et encore une fois, les antibiotiques, c'est très important, pas de retenu s'il vous plaît. J'espère que vous écoutez toujours [réverbération] "Ka-Ka-Ka-K-HECK" - votre source pour la météo, les nouvelles et la musique que j'aime.
C'est une autre journée ensoleillée, je suppose, mais il fait sacrément chaud ici.

Malheureusement, je n'ai reçu aucune nouvelle information. Je suppose que quelqu'un s'occupe toujours officiellement de quelque chose - un bureau à l'autre bout du monde où l'on peut encore se faire livrer des pizzas. En parlant de nourriture...
Si vous êtes près de West San Saba, offrez-vous un hamburger au tout nouveau Mmm, Bison ! Je vois qu'ils étaient sur le point d'ouvrir, d'après cette annonce. Il doit rester beaucoup de nourriture.
Restez prudents et gardez-moi un beefalo dipper.

dlgAnsw.text: <Le DJ commence à jouer de la musique.>

dlgLine.text: Je ne sais pas vraiment ce qui se passe, sincèrement. Je sais qu'il y a une infection, et je sais que les affaires courantes sont en suspend.

J'ai entendu des rumeurs selon lesquelles les morts se relèvent, mais on lit beaucoup de choses sur Internet. Je n'ai toujours pas d'overboard ni de chaton-biberon, alors je suis sûr que ce n'est qu'une exagération. Cette affaire pue la conclusion hâtive, comme c'est souvent le cas. Je ne sais pas...

Tout ce que je connais, ce sont ces murs, cette console sale, ces posters de pop stars country délavés et tout un tas de murs au milieu de nulle part. J'ai préparé la voiture et je suis parti dès que j'ai commencé à lire les blogs, il y a plus d'une semaine maintenant.
On est peut-être en sécurité ici, mais on s'ennuie. Peut-être que j'aurais dû avoir un co-animateur, quelqu'un pour jouer le son de la chasse d'eau de temps en temps.

Mais ce n'est pas le cas. Je compte donc sur vous pour me prouver que je ne me parle pas à moi-même. J'ai une radio ici et je surveille plusieurs fréquences. Faites-moi savoir la vérité sur ce qui se passe et je m'assurerai de faire passer le message.

En attendant, je papote et je joue la musique que j'aime. Mais lorsqu'un DJ jouit d'une autonomie totale à notre époque, c'est peut-être le signe que quelque chose a terriblement mal tourné. Quoi qu'il en soit, voici "I Want to Disbelieve You" par The Comb Meanies - bonne écoute, Hill Country.

Pour ceux d'entre vous avec qui j'ai pu bavarder sur les ondes courtes hier soir, je vous remercie d'avoir partagé vos histoires avec moi - et même d'avoir parlé avec moi. Cela faisait longtemps que je n'avais pas entendu un autre être humain que moi.
Jusqu'à présent, je n'étais pas sûr que quelqu'un m'écoutait et je pense que je ne savais pas vraiment comment était le monde en dehors des murs de ce studio.
Pour ceux qui sont à l'écoute en ce moment, sachez que vous n'êtes pas seuls. Il y a d'autres personnes qui vivent, qui essaient, qui espèrent - il y a d'autres personnes comme vous.

Mais j'ai aussi entendu des choses vraiment horribles. Ces choses là - les infectés, les monstres, quel que soit le nom qu'on leur donne... Je crois tout le monde quand ils disent que ces choses sont mortes. Je les crois vraiment.

Et je suis un sceptique de toujours, prêt à crier "conneries" à la moindre théorie du complot sur Internet, mais je dois admettre que si ça a l'air d'être mort, que ça marche comme si c'était mort, et que ça sent comme si c'était mort, il faut se tirer de là.

N'essayez pas de concilier la logique de la chose - la preuve vous saute aux yeux - enfin, j'espère qu'elle ne vous saute pas aux yeux, mais pour l'amour de Dieu, ne restez pas planté là comme si vous étiez ce type dans un film d'horreur. Trouvez un endroit sûr, quelqu'un pour surveiller vos arrières, un bon arsenal pour la sécurité et un an de réserves de haricots au beurre.
Et continuez à m'appeler, parce que je ne peux que m'amuser pendant un certain temps avant de disparaître...

dlgAnsw.text: <Le DJ semble avoir fait une pause.>

dlgLine.text: Il fait chaud aujourd'hui. Tellement chaud que j'ai vu un serpent à sonnette avaler une glace. Il fait si chaud que j'hésite à ouvrir la porte. Mais j'ai une confession à faire - vous êtes prêts ?

Je suis une énorme lâche. Et même si cet endroit est à des kilomètres de tout ce qui ressemble à la civilisation, la porte reste fermée pour l'instant. Je ne vais pas risquer la mort pour une simple brise.

Vous voulez savoir quelque chose de potentiellement hilarant ? Il est évident que cette station est toujours alimentée en électricité, n'est-ce pas ? Le premier jour, j'ai voulu allumer l'air conditionné et j'ai trouvé une note dessus. Je vais vous la lire tout de suite : "Ne pas allumer l'air conditionné. C'est cassé. Ne souffle que de l'air chaud. Un nouveau climatiseur sera installé la semaine prochaine.

C'est drôle, non ? Quelqu'un veut prendre des paris sur cette livraison ? Je commence à délirer, à transpirer... il fait si chaud... écoutons un peu de musique pour nous changer les idées. Voyons voir... Pony Airship, Bear Supply, Wolf Masons - tant de groupes de qui déchirent...
Ah, nous y voilà. Voici le tout dernier - ou peut-être le dernier - de Von Monsterface. Ça s'appelle "Plastic Guitar Star" et c'est la seule chose qui soit cool aujourd'hui...

Aujourd'hui, j'ai reçu un appel d'une auditrice de Loma Alta. Son commentaire était le suivant : "Lane, je me suis barricadée dans un bâtiment et je me sens en sécurité pour l'instant. Mais les morts sont partout au premier étage et leurs gémissements constants m'empêchent de dormir. Pourriez-vous jouer quelque chose qui atténue ce son horrible pour que je puisse me reposer quelques heures ?

Eh bien, Donna de Loma Alta, merci pour votre message. Je compatis à votre manque de sommeil et j'espère que cela vous aidera. Extrait de leur album de 1996, Kids Eat Steve, voici The Toast Magnets avec "Lil' Honey Butter"...

<Soupir> Je ne sais pas ce qui ne va pas chez nous en tant qu'espèce, mais d'après ce que j'entends, la plupart d'entre vous sont des cons et... non, ce n'est pas le bon mot - ce que je veux dire, c'est que la plupart d'entre vous sont de vrais trous du cul... Non, ce n'est toujours pas ça.
Oh, je l'ai - des connards irrécupérables, mais d'une manière qui n'est pas flatteuse.

Les morts reviennent à la vie, mangent les vivants, et vous vous entretuez pour des machines à cappuccino ? Je veux dire... comment en est-on arrivé là ? Ne sommes-nous pas censés nous unir contre un ennemi commun, ne sommes-nous pas censés devenir plus forts ?

Apparemment, non. Nous ne pouvons même pas coopérer alors que notre survie en dépend. Ce qui compte, c'est d'avoir un peu plus de choses, n'est-ce pas ? Qu'est-ce que c'est que cette histoire de gens qui n'arrêtent pas leur voiture pour des mères avec des enfants qui courent pour sauver leur vie ? Ou des gens qui se font tirer dessus pour des boîtes de conserve de potiron ?

Combien de personnes ont entendu de vrais humains frapper à leur porte et n'ont pas ouvert ? Ces personnes, c'est ça - c'est peut-être bien les derniers de l'humanité et vous vous inquiétez de ne plus avoir de tartes aux fruits et de vin bon marché ?
Bandes DE PETITS TROU DU CUL MISERABLES ! Qu'est-ce qui ne va pas chez vous ? Qu'est-ce qui ne va pas chez nous ?

<Soupir>... Désolé pour ce coup de gueule, j'avais besoin de me défouler. Pendant que j'essaie de retrouver mon calme et ma sérénité, voici Sparkle House avec "It's a Beautiful Life"... Ici sur KHEK. Ka... Ka... Ka... K-Heck, pourquoi diable vous n'écoutez pas ?

I received words of reassurance last night from May - who won’t give her location - over the shortwave. She says that she was concerned about me, how I sounded yesterday and called me to make sure I wasn’t giving up already. That was really sweet. And here’s what I had to tell her – no, May, I’m not giving up.

I’m here for all of you out there. I want to help keep people alive with information. I want to be a comforting voice when all people can hear is moaning or silence. I’m not going to let this beat me, and neither should you.
I know there are good people out there and I know that they are going to find a way to survive, and I’m here to remind you all of that.

May also told me that while she liked that someone was still playing music, she didn’t necessarily like my music. So, I asked May what she liked, and turns out she’s a country kind of girl. Bless her heart. Well, May, I’m afraid our musical tastes are a bit different, so I don’t have any of the names you were looking for.

But to make up for it, here’s a somewhat faithful cover of one of your favorite songs by a pretty redhead with a prettier voice. Here’s hoping it makes your day just a little better, May – thanks for worrying about me. Also, I can’t promise it – but I will try to keep the profanity to a minimum.
Today I’m introducing a feature called, 'Things I Miss' in which I talk about things I miss from what seems like years ago now.<Old-fashioned Music>

Do you remember aimless web-surfing? Man, I miss that. Just logging on, looking at the web links, updating your status... Here’s a confession – I still try to log on every single morning and evening hoping to get even the weakest connection.
And I’d like to say I miss knowing how people are and about the world, but I have this sinking suspicion that no new music is being created anymore, and I think that’s what troubles me the most.
I mean – think about it – there are no musicians finding each other, no new songs being rehearsed, no singles generating buzz on the blogs, no lives shows to see...
I lived for that stuff, and it’s not there anymore – it’s not going to be there tomorrow or the next day. All that energy and excitement and anticipation is just...

Well, it’s like you hit your web cache, right? And there’s a music site from a few weeks ago – and even though there were problems back then – that site was exploding with reviews, and new singles, and tour dates... And you just look at it now – it’s frozen, it’s stale, it’s a baby in formaldehyde.
All that fandom electricity, all those new flavors are locked in that last day of your favorite website. It’s... uh... ha...

You know what? I’m boring you. I’m telling you things you already know. You listen to me to escape that. I’m still here and I can still keep the music playing. Here’s something that’s new for you, probably – oh, this is a good one – brand new from Panda Airliner, here’s “Carrot Friends” on KHEK, where the music is still alive.

Still nothing new on the emergency wire for a week now… Last message, in case you didn’t hear, was that antibiotics will help keep you from dying if you get bit by the dead. That’s the only new information I have.
Also, the dead are coming back to life, presumably for the flesh and maybe the lulz. Yes, the human species is maybe not as high on the food chain as we once thought.

The laws have changed – the dead eat the living, cash is toilet paper, fire is back in style, houseboats are cool, Americans are doing their own construction, people are reading books for fun, creamed corn sounds tasty, and the guy on the radio can play anything he wants.
<Sigh>So, no new updates today, sorry. I really thought today would be the day... Well, so today isn’t a complete wash, here’s the Filtration Organizers with 'Pickle Me Too'.

That was something I found on my laptop – wasn’t that fun? Remember that simpler time when we all pondered the question of what exactly Willis was talking about? Man, I would kiss my cousin Frank’s blackhead-riddled nose to have cheesy TV programs be back in production.

We got so spoiled we didn’t even know how good we had it, watching a guy and his talking car fight crime. We had a billion channels, and now we have none. We’ve spent our whole lives being entertained, and being unplugged is terrifying.
I mean, why do you think I’m here? Beyond the public service aspect, I mean. Know why?

'Cause I'm terrified of leaving the comfort of what I knew. This dirty, hot, cramped booth, as bad as it is, still feels like home. Is it cowardly? Maybe... I mean, I may not even be reaching anyone right now. I might be talking to myself. I feel like I have to keep talking or...
Whew, my throat is dry – time for me to fetch a warm soda while we all find out what happened with that whole Gooch affair.

dlgAnsw.text: <Audio from a TV show starts playing.>

dlgLine.text: That was Casa Blanka with the song 'Wheat Heart' – wait a sec, no that was their other song, 'New Hair Tonic'. Sorry for the mixup – I’m dying from the heat today.

Sometimes I feel like I’m on a space station, like I’m just sitting in here, waiting for the next rocket. It’s not comfortable, my muscles are atrophying, the air is stale, but I can talk to you, mission control, and as much as it’d be nice to take a stroll, I know I can’t go outside.
Anyhow, hot makes sleepy – apologies if I fall asleep at the console and accidentally play something prog. Stay cool, stay safe, stay in touch.

Had some good chats with some of my listeners last night – I needed that – thanks, guys and gals. Hadn’t heard from some of you since last week and I was starting to worry. Here’s some advice from some of my friends out there in the land of the dead.

Devon from Crystal Springs recommends that you not use guns, as they tend to attract attention. He says that if they don’t hear you, they won’t find you. He recommends taking a crowbar as an all purpose tool for opening doors and bashing skulls.

Frank from Frank’s Basement has an alternate philosophy and recommends using loud noises to draw surprises out of houses before he looks for supplies. Sounds kooky, but Frank’s doing okay, so maybe it works.

Georgia - the girl, not the state - recommends you always take a gas can with you because you never know when you’re going to find some. Apparently having the generator go out while trying to stitch a cut is never a good thing.
Country Girl May recommends you brush up on your wild plants and pick your own food. May tells me that the farms and orchards out her way have plenty of food in them if you know what to look for.
Cool stuff, guys. Hope that comes in handy to everyone out there. My recommendation - listen to this next track.

I think we’re going to get through this. As a species, you know, we’ve been through a whole lot of terrible shit. And maybe they didn’t make sense at first – seemed like acts of gods or devils – but we made sense of them, years after the fact.
Like, let’s see – for one, didn’t we come up as a species in an ice age? Or how about all those epidemics we survived – smallpox, bubonic plague, Spanish flu.

We’ve had civilizations like the Romans and Egyptians and Aztecs fall apart at the seams, and yet, we go on. Economic collapse, super hurricanes, volcanoes, famine – you throw it at us and we come back in even greater numbers.

We’re tenacious sons of bitches in evolutionary terms – we’re harder to get rid of than rats or roaches because we will poison or cure or shoot or club or set fire to anything that dares to wipe us out. Even when it’s us versus us, we can’t even beat us.

Now, I know I’m just a guy who’s not even near the worst of it. But believe me, if you trust your instincts, if you tap into the essence of being human, you will find the strength to overcome and kick the ass of this.
It’s not the end of the world, just a setback. And just to prove it, I’ll be playing tunes you could set a montage to all day. Go out there and conquer, my fine, fellow humans.

A lot of you might have children who are confused about what’s going on. To help, I made this list of phrases you can use to explain why the dead are coming back to life to them in a way a child can understand. Get a pad and pencil. Okay, ready?
Number five – You remember when your pet goldfish died? Well, it’s like that, except a lot worse.
Number four – Well, at least you won’t have to worry about overpopulation.
Number three – You load the shells here, and press this thing to shoot – make mommy proud!
Number two – This kind of thing happens all the time – it happened when I was a kid.
And… Number One on our list of the top five things to say to kids to explain the dead coming back to life – Something you did must have really pissed off God.
But in all seriousness, stay safe out there, boys and girls.

dlgAnsw.text: <The host seems to be humming something.>

dlgLine.text: So, I figured that since it was the end of the world and everything, most of this food I took with me is not exactly diet or even really food.

And so I’m sitting here stuffing my face with a pudding pie and reading the label – because what else am I going to read – and it struck me that these snack cakes have so many preservatives that they will probably outlive humanity.
And right here on the label I notice that these things come from a factory right here in Central Texas – the Wholeman’s Snacks factory in Balinger, to be specific.
So if any of you in that area can get there, you’ll probably find a spongy yellow goldmine waiting for you. And no fighting okay? There should be plenty of diabetes to go around, so share the bounty.
I would suck the high fructose corn syrup right out of Chunkie the Kid for a few more packs of his delicious frosted cakes... Was that too much information? Apologies.

dlgAnsw.text: <The host repeats the information about the snack factory.>

dlgLine.text: ...I think that last track was called, 'Problems Pretending to be Solutions' maybe...
Anyhow, the lyrics made me think of just how many people I hate are probably dead now. People who I’m glad are dead. Oh, I know it sounds terrible, but I take some comfort in it.
Let’s see... I could name a lot of politicians, but I’m guessing they took the first flight out of shit mountain when the crisis got hot.
So, who else... the inventor of the backwards hat look, Christian rock bands, people who enjoy candy that is also gum, anyone who produced or directed a movie based on a board game...
Cable company execs, guys who wear skinny jeans, people who think music was better when they were younger, old people who rallied against government health care in Medicaid scooters... <deep breath>

The clowns who hung on to internet memes years after they ceased to be amusing, also actual clowns, Tyler Brody – you don’t know him, all the women who ever been on a show about being rich housewives in expensive cities, whack rappers...

OH, people who took two spots when parking so their luxury car wouldn’t get scratched, jackwads who spend the entire concert on or holding up their phone, multiple people I used to work for, entertainment news hosts, um...

Huh… this list just goes on and on. I guess when you think about it, it’d be comforting to know there are living people out there – even if they are assholes – compared to the alternative. Sorry, everybody. I should just cut to music – here’s Faded Cassette with 'Day-Glo Afternoon' – have a good day, human beings.

I might have mentioned Donna on the radio before – actually, I’m sure I did. Well, I got a call from a Tommy who says that Donna helped lead him and his daughter out of a bad situation and let them stay with her. He said that he and Donna were out looking for food for his little girl and encountered a larger group of survivors.
Tommy got scared and fired a warning shot. Apparently, this was taken as a threat and the group came after them.

Donna was shot, pretty much immediately. Um, she told Tommy to get back to his daughter while she held off their attackers – still firing at them with a bullet in her gut, no less. She sounded pretty tough, but...

Anyhow, Tommy wanted to tell me that my show was what helped Donna keep her wits when she was alone. He thought I should know that. Tommy and his daughter are safe, by the way. I really hope they make it. And I really hope people think about Donna the next time they run into another person out there.
And now I’m going to do something I never do – let’s have a moment of silence. For Donna and other friends no longer with us...
Good morning. You just heard 'Carry On' from British Naval Battles. Coming up next, cold refried beans for me and more music for... hold on a sec.
I think there’s something outside. Sounds like something walking through the pebbles out front. Shhh...

<Whispering> More crunching... going around the building... Definitely something out there... I’m not going to open the door, but maybe I can get a peek out of the bathroom window in the back... be right back...
<There appears to be footsteps coming from somewhere in the studio.>
<You think you can hear a faint sound of something happening away from the microphone.>

Still alive… I don’t believe what I just saw - it was a mountain lion! Must have been passing through. Normally, I would be terrified, but after being trapped in here for so long… it was amazing – majestic even.

Have the animals already started taking territory back? Huh... that’s a comforting, yet distressing thought. Well, since they run the show now, this next one goes out to all the lions – from the band Smile You Waving Adonis, here’s 'The Unbearable Lioness of Being' here on K-Heck, where we take pride in our music...
Ha. I know, that was bad, but you try coming up with fifteen hours of material a day.

Some of my friends out there finally managed to get on the radio again. Sounds like times have been tough, but they’ve come up with some ways of dealing with it. I’m going to pass their advice on to you – maybe it’ll help.

Frank told me that he used a stun gun on a dead guy as a last resort and it did work. He got all scientific on me and explained how it probably shocked the muscle tissue. If you have to risk getting close to one, maybe carry this as a last defense.

Georgia told me that when she does go out, she wears a gas mask and brings homemade tear gas. Says that it’s allowed her to escape from some of the nastier individuals out there without having to fight them off.
And finally, May told me she’s started raising chickens. They pretty much take care of themselves and she’s eating fresh eggs daily. I can smell the omelets now.
I haven’t heard from a few of my other regulars. Let me know you guys are okay. For everybody else out there, I’m pulling for you.

dlgAnsw.text: <The host seems to be microwaving something.>

dlgLine.text: How many days have I been doing this now? How many times a day do I keep trying to get a web page to load? How often do I check the emergency system feed? No news, no news... nothing at all. Nothing officially anyway. I’m literally running out of things to talk about.

I’m so used to information being replenished at an encyclopedia per second. As the only source of media in the area, I feel like I'm letting you down. And so, I’m going to do what so many lazy journalists and bloggers have done before me and make up some news for you. Here we go.

Today’s top story – Tallahassee Ted, the tragedy-predicting wallaby, saw a mailman outside his hutch, which forecasts six more weeks of despair. Officials are still waiting for corresponding data from Itchy the mood lemur and Robert the cat that doesn’t give a fuck.
In sports, a ball was brought from one side of the field to another side. It was then brought back to the other side, and sometimes into the middle. Orange won.

If we take a look at our weather satellite, you’ll notice a strong front of unbearable coming up from the Gulf, with a strong broiling event about to hit us around this afternoon. Sun block is highly recommended as a dessert. Non-toxic cocoa butter on a saltine is a refreshing low-calorie snack.

Now on to entertainment. Today’s review is of the new movie Charly Horse, about a mentally-handicapped man who swaps bodies with a racehorse and wins a derby. I’m not really sure what lesson I was supposed to learn from this movie, but the boat chase was amazing.
Also, the dead are coming back to life. That’s all the news that matters today – have a great day folks.

I think it’s time for another confession... I started doing this when I thought I’d come into the station, play what I wanted, have a few laughs, and eventually get arrested. I thought it would be a matter of days – in fact, I was paranoid that the door would be kicked in at any minute and that I was going to be dragged off.
Sure, I brought plenty of supplies with me – just in case – but I was pretty sure I wasn’t going to get away with this for very long.

Well, the days went on, and it seemed less like a goof and more like a responsibility. But still, I waited for that door to be busted in, to have someone in authority, someone from a structured organization to come in and take me out of here.

I would wake up in the morning and just hope that today was the day. I didn’t care if I went away for a year – I just wanted someone to be out there with the authority, with the resources, the order...

But it never happened. So much time has passed in this shitty little building, and I’m faced with the prospect that no one is coming... There’s nobody out there to clean up this mess. No fines, no losing my job, no offense, because there is no establishment to give a shit.

And that’s frightening, as much as I told myself I hated authority. It’s all gone. There’s you, me, and the dead. And now that it’s sunk in, I’m kinda... terrified. Except not 'kinda' at all. Anyhow... thought I’d share.
You just heard 'Zero to Gyro' from Quatropussy. I met them back when I was spinning in a real city – nice gals, which probably means they’re no longer with us. That’s a shame...
Given current events, we could all use a bit of levity, yeah? Something to make us laugh. So, I thought I’d tell the only joke I know. Are you excited? Here I go.
So there’s a rabbit, an armadillo, and a turtle trying to cross a busy highway.

The rabbit boasts – ‘my speed will get me across that street before a car can hit me.’ The armadillo counters him and says – ‘speed is nice, but my armor will protect me against a car any day!’ Turtle tries to say something, but the rabbit pushes him out of the way and announces that he’s going to go first.

So the rabbit darts out into the street and smack! Run right over. The turtle starts to say something, but the armadillo laughs at the rabbit’s misfortune and tells the turtle he’ll see him on the other side of the street. So, the armadillo starts crossing and... smash! Flattened by a truck.

Finally it’s the turtle’s turn. He stares at the mangled bodies of the turtle and armadillo out in the street and looks both ways at the cars rushing by him and says, 'fuck it, I didn’t feel like Italian food anyway.'

dlgAnsw.text: <The host laughs to himself and then seems to go off mic.>

dlgLine.text: Just trying to keep it together... I know you're listening... I’m talking to someone... I’m having a conversation with a very quiet person... I’m working a long shift... Ha ha...

Talk, talk, talk... blah, blah, blah... Play something that only you will enjoy... Statement of hope... Humor in the face of adversity... Song only you will like... Convincing yourself you are helping... Blathering for the sake of it... Play a song only you will like... Complain about the weather...
It’s hot… I’m still alive and I hope you are too... Nothing really new to say... Here’s a song.
That wraps up fifteen songs in a row. Up next, some more music. Here’s The Secret Grandmas with 'Look at Me, I’m a Joke' here on Ka... ka... ka... ka... K...Heck... Where I’m bored...
Hey, do you remember planes? Those things that used to be all over the sky? Real loud, looked like metal birds?

Well, two different listeners report that that they have seen a plane flying around the Hamilton Airfield. Seems like someone has a plane still, but if they got a way to get out of here, they probably won’t be around for long. Someone should go check that out.

Maybe this is a good sign? Reinforcements on their way? Supply drops? Answers? I don’t know, but it’s the most encouraging news I’ve heard in a long time. Hope it helps someone out there. Maybe even me.
This calls for something special. From 1998, here’s 'In an Airplane, Over the Ocean' in its entirety. I’m going to excuse myself before I get a bit misty-eyed. We’ll talk later...

Well, I guess I’m still here and for how much longer, I don’t know. Not trying to be a fatalist or anything, in fact, I think this might be the longest I’ve ever stuck with one activity. I don’t think I’ve had this much focus since I was a kid.

Speaking of being a kid, I was listening to my mp3s yesterday, and I don’t remember adding this song, but it was this really cheesy song from 1981 and it made me remember this moment where I was sitting in the back of my mom’s car and she was driving somewhere – probably running errands.

It was warm and she had this light rock station on that just played some of the worst pop of the time. I think this was the day when I realized I had way better taste than her when it came to music, actually.
But I digress... So I’m sitting there and she’s trying to sing along with this song, getting all the words wrong and – did I mention my mother is tone deaf?

It was such a weird thing to remember, but I could recall everything so vividly – that cheesy song playing, the words my mom butchered, the sun on my legs, the wind through the rolled window, the smell of the faux-leather seats, and the feeling that I didn’t have a care in the world that day.

And as horrible as that song was, I would listen to it a thousand – no – a million times in a row if it meant feeling like that again. I want radio stations to play terrible music, and jaunts to the grocery store, and days where doing nothing is a viable decision... So here’s a song from a much different time – hope it reminds you of simpler days too.

I’ve recently talked to a few of my friends on the radio. Some of them have been forced to leave their houses due to the amount of dead in their towns. I guess there are some pretty big mobs of those things out there.
I hear there’s supposed to be a few groups of people out there that are holding up, even looking for other survivors, but be careful who you reveal yourself to.
Frank tells me there’s a group of guys on motorcycles out there. He said he didn’t try to make contact because they looked dangerous.
May didn’t have much to tell me, but she says her vegetables are coming in nicely. If you’re listening, May, I know you told me that cough was nothing, but you take it easy on yourself, okay?
Tommy tells me he met a group led by a doctor. Since his daughter wasn’t with him, he didn’t join them, but he says he thought the doctor’s bodyguard was intimidating.

Also, Tommy’s daughter requested a song – said she thought I could use a pick me up. So, going out to my youngest listener, here’s 'Great Vibrations' – here’s hoping it brings some positive energy into your day.

A thought occurred last night – did anyone ever find out what was up with that plane over in Hamilton? I sure hope so. I’d sure fly out of here if I could. Did I already say that? Everything’s starting to become a blur. I should put on some math rock to give my brain a workout.

Where the heck did I put that CD? Man, this place is starting to take its toll on me. I’m pretty sure I woke up this morning thinking someone was pounding on the door – turned out to be drums from my headphones, but it scared the piss out of me...
I don’t really sleep much anymore – just kind of drift in and out of consciousness... Heat, stress, I don’t know... Did I mention the plane again? Oh, yeah – yeah...<yawn>

dlgAnsw.text: <You think the host has fallen asleep at the console.>

dlgLine.text: It finally happened today. I ran out of a necessary item. I knew it was a matter of time before I ran out of something critical. Guess I’m kind of screwed. I don’t know what I’m going to do...

Life without gum. I blame the cigarettes – I mean, the gum addiction is a direct result of quitting smoking years ago. And you know what’s funny, is I’m looking through the station manager’s desk – I’m sure he doesn’t care anymore – and I found a half-full pack of smokes in there.
Now, I could just light one up, but I hear this voice in my head that says, ‘you’ll take years off your life if you do that!’
Oh, man, that’s some logic failure right there. But I guess running out of gum is better than running out of cigarettes in a day. I wonder how many people have bit it just looking for smokes?
Best not to think about it, huh? I’m going to chew up some pens now – here’s Tarmac’s 'Desk Gum Chewer' to enjoy while I go get ink poisoning.

Good morning, it’s a beautiful day here in the West Middle Of Nowhere, Texas. Today’s forecast calls for highs in the mid-100s, with a corpse front coming in from the North to put a damper on those afternoon barbecues.

In the news – I am running out of corn chips. Alright, I’m going to open up the lines now. First caller gets a KHEK apocalypse survival kit which includes a pointy stick, a bottle of Tom Collins mix, and a sweatshirt that reads ‘I’m Fuckable’.

dlgAnsw.text: <The host seems to be eating crackers.>

dlgLine.text: This is day... feels like three thousand of my radio broadcast. Trying to think of the last good thing that happened to me. Maybe a little over a month ago? Maybe. I was at this shitty club in Dublin – that would be Dublin, Texas – and I saw one of my favorite acts.

She’s been in a bunch of bands and you’ve probably heard her guest star on countless albums, but I love her solo stuff – her name is Aggro Moss. It’s just her and a guy playing stripped down indie rock with a hint of blues and danger. I think that was the last normal day I had ever.

But what a great show that was. Wonder if she made it? For all I know she could still be there, singing, drinking as the world becomes a faded photo. I’d kill to hear that voice again. Don’t get me wrong, she’s easy on the eyes, squeezes sex from every note, but I just want to hear some good, live dirty rock music one more time.

<Sigh> I made myself sad just now. Guess I’ll have to settle for the record version. Going out to that raven-haired indie siren, here’s Aggro Moss with 'Your Love is a Hitman' – hope you’re still with us, killer.

We had water jugs at the station for the water cooler, but I’m thinking I need to take steps to conserve fluid. So, I always heard urine was sterile and that you could drink it in an emergency. Naturally, I thought I’d do an impromptu urine tasting on the show. Today I’ll be trying a freshly bottled batch of home-brewed, organic Lane-monade.

First off, let’s start with the bouquet – I’m getting a hoppy bouquet with hints of caramel and brussel sprout. Okay... giving it a swirl around the mouth. Got a not too unpleasant, almost lemony or green taste with maybe an umami flavor on the backend.
Aftertaste could be better, but I’m guessing that’s just a result of it not having time to smooth out like a vintage pee. Hmm, you know, it’s not half bad.
<Sipping noise.>
PSYCH! I’d never do that. I’m much more likely to starve to death anyhow. But all in good time. Happy foraging, everybody.
This is DJ Lane, bringing you sounds of life in a dead world.

Oh, c’mon, I can do better than that... No, I guess I can’t. I don’t even know if anyone is listening... Nothing on the radio...Tired of these walls... But yet I carry on, because I care. I do. I didn’t always care much about people, but the apocalypse will do odd things to you. I’m worried about you, May, Tommy and daughter, Georgia, Devon, Donna...
Oh, wait, Donna’s gone...
I need to know you are all alive. Get on the radio. It’s important to-
<Static>

dlgAnsw.text: <You listen for another minute, but there' s nothing but static.>

dlgLine.text: Hello, listeners. It finally happened – the power to this station is gone. I’m running the generator with our gas reserves and I’ve pretty much cannibalized my car of parts and fuel to keep this place going. It was weird being outside, but then, I didn’t really want to go very far. Think I’ll finish the set here, so to speak.

Due to current circumstances, I’ll only be broadcasting for an hour a day now. I’ve also got my car battery hooked up to my shortwave radio, so please call me when you can. Pretty sure with the current fuel supplies I can keep the station going for a few more weeks.
Let’s not waste any more time on trivialities. Here’s 'Doom’s Day' from MC Metal Fingers. I’m still here people. Good luck, friends.
Day two with limited power. It’s tempting to keep it running. I used to have the computer going, which felt kind of normal. Power to charge my mp3 player, my tablet, my e-book, my game system...
They’re all starting to die. I’m just sitting in this dark, hot clamshell of a radio station with nothing to do, waiting for the next broadcast.
But enough about me... Still waiting on hearing from any of you out there. What else did I want to say? I had twenty-four hours to come up with something. Oh, well...
Standing by for your calls. In the meantime, listen to this. It’s pretty and it doesn’t matter who it’s by.
Hello...? Is anyone there? Helllooooo...

This is the worst summer ever. Like getting to the beach and realizing your ghetto blaster is missing batteries. And that the beach is empty. And the sharks are everywhere. And the stairs to the parking lot are on fire.

There’s got to be somebody alive out there. I know I’m not smart enough to be the last person alive. So, you gotta call me. We can talk about anything you want – girls, ponies, famous authors, the worst fuck of your life, puppets you thought were kinda hot. Or if you just want to beat box or play me your new steel drum solo - whatever works.
My watch is telling me my time is up. Speak to you all tomorrow.

dlgAnsw.text: <The station cuts off and all you hear is static.>

dlgLine.text: <Static>
Just kicked the generator. It’s acting up. Shit – I don’t like that noise-
<Static>

dlgAnsw.text: <The radio station does not seem to be coming back on today.>

dlgLine.text: I knew you were out there. I got a radio message from Tommy last night. Good to know he’s still going strong and just hear his voice. He’s had to relocate again, due to a run-in with some paramilitary nutjobs – he didn’t go into details. He says his daughter is lonely but continues to be brave. I’m really happy for them.

It wasn’t all good news though. He said he’s seen a lot of dead bodies out there – not the walking kind, but the killed by people kind. He’s seen people crucified, hanging, set out as warnings against intruders. Real sick shit. Tommy says he keeps trying to go to more remote areas to escape other people as much as the dead.

Well, good work coming this far, Tommy. I’m a happier person for knowing you’re out there. If everyone else could give me a ring on the old radio, I’d appreciate that. Right now, my fuel’s getting low and I gotta go. Hasta banana, listeners.

dlgAnsw.text: <The radio station cuts to static again.>

dlgLine.text: I know I tend to ramble, but this is important news for anyone in the Cedar Park area. Tommy tells me a fire seems to be spreading fast and that the dry grass and lack of firefighters means that this could be the end of that whole region.

Don’t bother calling 911, people – this is your last chance to take what you can get from the stores and houses in the Cedar Park area. If you’re nesting nearby like Tommy, gather your valuables and head to somewhere out of the affected area.

I know there’s a lot of danger out there, but fire doesn’t discriminate. I’d wager from his description that you have three days to pack up and move out. After that, the only thing you’re going to find out there is ash. I’ll be repeating this message for the rest of the morning...

dlgAnsw.text: <The DJ begins to repeat the message.>

dlgLine.text: Cedar park fire rages on. Haven’t heard from Tommy, but fire doesn’t just stop, so get while the getting is good. You can probably smell the smoke in the surrounding towns - I'm nowhere near there, just passing it on.
In other bad news, I realized today that my food supply is running low. Finished the last of the peanut butter last night, and let me tell you, eating that stuff had become the highlight of my day.
I’m so hard up for the taste that I would even eat circus peanuts right about now. Anyone know any good recipes for chip dust and pinto beans?

I guess starvation isn’t so bad when the alternative is being eaten. Not like I could go anywhere with my car disassembled. I looked through it this morning and all I could find was this CD mix I made. I don’t know what’s on it, so why don’t we find out? It’ll make the salted cardboard go down a little easier...

I’m trying hard to conserve my resources. I’m just staring at a bag of mixed nuts like it’s the body of every girl I ever had a crush on. It’s compounded pathetic set to the sounds of stomach gurgling.
It’s like all I’ve been doing for the past three hours, and I can feel my willpower hanging on for dear life as the airlock door sucks it right into the void.

Gotta think about something else. Oh - whatever happened to May? May – are you out there? How are you? How’s that cough – better? Are you still alive? How about you, Devon? Or Frank? Or Georgia? Who’s left? Because I don’t want it to be me.
Really, I’m not important. I’m a failed DJ – stupid enough to get into radio when no one wanted DJs anymore. Did I make any difference the last few weeks? Huh? To Frank or Tommy or May or anyone?
Who did I really do this for? Is it really broadcasting if there’s no one out there to listen to it? Can anyone hear me? Can you-
<Static>

dlgAnsw.text: <After a minute of listening to static, you think the broadcast might be done for the day.>

dlgLine.text: I tried to make a list of albums I needed to hear before I died and failed. There were just too many.

Then I tried to narrow it down to songs and it was just as hard. Can you fathom that? Listening to your favorite album for the last time? The last time you’ll ever hear the drumbeat or the chorus or the fade out?

I can’t. I can’t make one last mixtape. There are so many songs I want to hear again. How do you pick the last album you ever hear? What if you die during your least favorite song on it? Or if you put them all on shuffle and you take your last breath during a drum solo?

Is it better just to die to silence? No, I bet that’s when some shitty ear worm pops into your head and you kick off in a fit of what-the-fuck. This is going to take some more thought... Going to have to call it a day.

<Cough> This is Lane Vibesit, ladies and gentleman, here to assure you that the preceding radio broadcasts are mere works of entertainment in your time. Much like the War of the Worlds radio program, there were no actual dead coming back to life, and everything is actually peachy.

The dogs are barking, the neighbor’s firing up the grill, kids are doing sick tricks on BMX bikes in the street, the internet is full of new hilarious videos, college girls are sunning themselves on the campus green...

The shops are fully stocked and bright with fluorescent light, the pool is blue and your raft has a daiquiri in the cup holder, the air-conditioning is humming, and you have learned to appreciate life.

I hope you are receiving this, people of the past. Before things fall apart, pay close attention. You had it so good. Please learn from the mistakes presented in this radio play. Remember the terrible lesson you learned today. Signing off from the future, I’m Lane Vibesit.
...Is this thing on? Well, okay.

This is my final transmission. There’s not much else I can do for you or me at this point. I’ve had my ups and downs here, but I’m sure glad I got to go out doing what I loved. How many people can say that?

I’m not really good at saying goodbye, so... I’m going to say a few last words and that’s it. That’s the end of radio. We have come to the close of our broadcast days. Wherever you are, whoever you are – thank you for listening. Good luck to all of you. No, really.
Well... so long, folks. For the last time ever, this is Lane Vibesit, signing off.

dlgAnsw.text: <The station is suddenly replaced with static.>

dlgLine.text: <Static>

dlgAnsw.text: <There is nothing but static coming from this station anymore.>
